title: Teen diagnosed with deadly illness caused by working out too much
content: A Texas teen was taken to the hospital and diagnosed with a potentially deadly disease after hitting the gym too hard (KTRK/CNN Newsource)      HOUSTON, Texas (WKRC) - A Texas teen was taken to the hospital and diagnosed with a potentially deadly disease after hitting the gym too hard, according to a story by KTRK .    Jared Shamburger, 17, was hospitalized for five days with Rhabdomyolysis, a disease that causes a breakdown of muscle tissue, releasing a damaging protein into the blood, possibly damaging the kidneys.    Rhabdo can be caused by many things including injury, infection, and overexertion.    The key is getting the disease diagnosed and treated right away.    Fortunately for Jared, he made it to the hospital in time and is expected to make a full recovery.
